_sText:
Counter-Strike: Source : Bot's Navigation Mesh for the map DE_INDUSTRIAL_BETA


Nav Creator: Meurglis3, Release Date: June 27 2014

Here is the Navigation Mesh for the nice designed industrial-themed map [de_industrial_beta](http://css.gamebanana.com/maps/158348) by Warhawk3407 (released July 2011). It's a totally created from scratch and manually optimized (hand-tuned) .nav-file because an original mapauthor's .nav-file embedded in BSP was not perfect, imho.

More than 80% of all areas and paths were created manually because during an auto-generation processing the majority of them were constructed incorrectly.

Well... it is necessary to notice that the fire-escape protected with a lattice still causes in bots some difficulties - sometimes they don't want to give a way to each other! But as a whole bots play pretty well and use all paths available to passing ;-)

Also this Navigation Mesh was fully Place Painted.

NOTES:

- For possibility of comparison and in-game testing the original auto-gen navigation file in .bsp-file and available to downloading with the [same map](http://css.gamebanana.com/maps/158348);

- See also hand-tuned NAV for Hostage Rescue version of this nice indudtrial-themed map by Warhawk3407 - [cs_idustrial_beta](http://css.gamebanana.com/gamefiles/3747).

Play and Enjoy! All remarks and messages are always welcomed.

Credits and Gratitudes:
   Warhawk3407 (for fine designed and high detailed industrial-themed map).

Additional Gratitudes:
   BarnDoor (for perfect playable navigation meshes for many fine CS:S maps),
   Chizbone (for informative and clever article BOT_BRAINED and a set of excellent navigation meshes),
   CoCoNUT (for fine hand-tuned navigation meshes for many fine CS:S maps),
   Valve Developer Community (for learning articles by Navigation Meshes and Navigation Mesh Commands).

Sprinkle snow with red, yeah..? ;-)

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

**UPDATED 20.11.2014**

General Fixes:
- Place Names are changed (replaced on more corresponding to environment);
- Some other minor improvements.

**PLEASE REDOWNLOAD UPDATED ARCHIVE!**
